record.field: A contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses that infect the nose, throat, and sometimes the lungs.
Fever, cough, sore throat, runny or stuffy nose, body aches, headache, chills, fatigue
Rest, fluid intake, antiviral medications in severe cases or for high-risk patients; supportive care.
A highly contagious disease caused by the varicella-zoster virus, characterized by an itchy rash and red spots or blisters all over the body.
Itchy rash, fever, tiredness, loss of appetite, headache
Calamine lotion, antihistamines for itch, antiviral drugs for severe cases; vaccination is preventive.
A chronic condition that affects the way the body processes blood sugar (glucose). Not infectious.
Increased thirst, frequent urination, hunger, fatigue, blurred vision, slow-healing sores
Lifestyle changes (diet, exercise), oral hypoglycemic agents, insulin in advanced cases; long-term monitoring.
